Key Match Events: Joel Embiid had an up-and-down performance with 13 points on 2-for-11 shooting from the field, but finished with 8-for-8 from the free throw line, 3 rebounds, 5 assists and 1 block in a 111-99 loss to the Knicks.
Pre-Game Insights: Joel Embiid said regaining confidence in pushing off hard on his troublesome left knee will take time, and that he would lobby to play against the 12-0 Cleveland Cavaliers on Wednesday.
Post-Match Reflections: Embiid noted that the decision to play Wednesday would be up to the 76ers medical staff, and that the team is hoping to get back to full strength with the return of Tyrese Maxey.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Knicks (5-5) have had the same starting lineup available for their 10 games, and Karl-Anthony Towns had one of his best all-around performances as a Knick with 21 points, 13 rebounds and 6 assists.
Others: The 76ers (2-8) are hoping to get on the floor together and learn how to play with each other, with health being a big thing for the team.
